alert.note: Alert for Wabasha (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 10 at 8:35PM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Minnesota... Mississippi River at Wabasha affecting Buffalo and Wabasha Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is expected late this week. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Wabasha. * WHEN...From late Thursday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Wisconsin Highway 35 between Maiden Rock and Stockholm may experience flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Monday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning.
